meanings.sent1: The government decided to secularise the schools by removing all religious symbols.
meanings.sent2: She wanted to secularise her wedding ceremony to make it more inclusive.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to secularise his magic show by replacing the traditional spells with science experiments.
meanings.sent4: The artist secularised the sacred painting by adding modern elements to it.
meanings.sent5: The chef secularised the traditional recipe by using only locally sourced ingredients.

meanings.definition: To remove religious or spiritual influence from something
meanings.sent1: The museum decided to secularise the exhibit by removing all references to religious beliefs.
meanings.sent2: The government aimed to secularise the legal system to ensure equal treatment for all citizens.
meanings.sent3: The ghost hunters tried to secularise the haunted house by debunking the supernatural myths.
meanings.sent4: The author secularised the ancient legend by retelling it in a purely historical context.
meanings.sent5: The scientist secularised the ancient ritual by explaining it through natural phenomena.
